title: 107_hr5198
content: The Act may be cited as the "Premier Certified Lenders Program Improvement Act of 2002". The Premier Certified Lenders Program (PCLP) has been successful in helping small businesses expand. Increasing the number of premier certified lenders will provide more resources to small businesses. Requiring lenders to maintain unnecessarily large loss reserve accounts limits their ability to serve more businesses. Lenders should maintain loss reserve accounts based on the risk associated with the loan portfolio. Changing the PCLP to require premier certified lenders to maintain loss reserve accounts reflecting loan risk will protect taxpayers and enhance the program's support for small business economic development. SEC. 3. ALTERNATIVE LOSS RESERVE FOR CERTAIN PREMIER CERTIFIED LENDERS. Alternative loss reserve option for qualified high loss reserve Premier Certified Lenders allows them to elect different requirements for contributions to their loss reserve in a calendar quarter. The subparagraph (A) requires companies to make contributions to their loss reserve before the last day of each quarter to ensure it meets certain minimum requirements and protects the Federal Government from risk. The term 'qualified high loss reserve PCL' refers to premier certified lenders designated by the Administrator. The company must maintain a loss reserve of at least $25,000 and analyze the risk of loss for each PCLP loan. A third-party auditor must certify the adequacy of the loss reserve quarterly for companies designated as qualified high loss reserve PCLs. The company must maintain a loss reserve of at least $25,000 for each PCLP loan. A third-party auditor must certify the adequacy of the loss reserve quarterly. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to specify two periods for the fiscal year: one from January 1 to September 30, and the other from October 1 to December 31. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to Section 508(b)(2)(D) by removing a reference to subsection (c)(2) and replacing it with subsection (c).
